paragraphs.text:
%md # Introduction to Zeppelin

Use the following cell to import the necessary libraries to complete the lab.

msg.data:
Introduction to Zeppelin

Use the following cell to import the necessary libraries to complete the lab.

paragraphs.text:
# Libraries
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from sqlalchemy import create_engine
import re

%md
If you want to be able to print all the columns of a dataframe in pandas, remember to run the following line of code:

msg.data: If you want to be able to print all the columns of a dataframe in pandas, remember to run the following line of code:

paragraphs.text: pd.set_option('display.max_columns', None)

%md
Let's start with the challenge!
#### 1.- Read the dataset. You can find the data in Ironhack's database.

* db: `liquor`
* table: `stores_sales`

msg.data:
Let’s start with the challenge!

1.- Read the dataset. You can find the data in Ironhack’s database.

  • db: liquor
  • table: stores_sales

paragraphs.text:
driver = "mysql+pymysql"
user = "ironhacker_read"
password = "ir0nhack3r"
ip = "35.239.232.23"
database = "liquor"

connection_string = f"{driver}://{user}:{password}@{ip}/{database}"
    
engine = create_engine(connection_string)

query = """
        SELECT * FROM store_sales
"""

liquor_store_sales = pd.read_sql(query, engine)
#liquor_store_sales.to_csv(../liquor_store_sales.csv)
liquor_store_sales= pd.read_csv("/home/chao/Desktop/Ironhack/Lab/Week_4_lab/lab-intro-to-zeppelin/liquor_store_sales.csv")

%md

#### 2.- Once the dataset is imported, change the data type of `Year` to string.

msg.data: 2.- Once the dataset is imported, change the data type of Year to string.

paragraphs.text:
liquor_store_sales["Year"] = liquor_store_sales["Year"].astype(str)
liquor_store_sales.info()

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 3.- Create a new dataframe column called `Quarter` by binning the `Month` column with 4 bins. Each bin should include all the rows whose month belongs to their associated quarter of the year. So for example, the second bin should include all rows whose month is in the second quarter of the year. Make sure that labels for the returned bins are `Q1`, `Q2`, `Q3`, and `Q4` respectively. 
**Hint**: Investigate these two methods and decide which one is the best to solve this challenge: [qcut](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.qcut.html) or [cut](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/reference/api/pandas.cut.html).

msg.data:
3.- Create a new dataframe column called Quarter by binning the Month column with 4 bins. Each bin should include all the rows whose month belongs to their associated quarter of the year. So for example, the second bin should include all rows whose month is in the second quarter of the year. Make sure that labels for the returned bins are Q1, Q2, Q3, and Q4 respectively.

Hint: Investigate these two methods and decide which one is the best to solve this challenge: qcut or cut.

paragraphs.text:
labels = ["Q1", "Q2", "Q3", "Q4"]
liquor_store_sales["Quater"] = pd.cut(liquor_store_sales["Month"], 4, labels = labels)
liquor_store_sales.head()

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 4.- Use a bar chart to plot the total `RetailSales` by `Year` and `Quarter`.

msg.data: 4.- Use a bar chart to plot the total RetailSales by Year and Quarter.

paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT Year, Quater, SUM(RetailSales) Total FROM liquor_store_sales GROUP BY Year, Quater

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 5.- Use a bar chart to plot the average `RetailSales` by `Year` and `Quarter`.

msg.data: 5.- Use a bar chart to plot the average RetailSales by Year and Quarter.

paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT Year, Quater, AVG(RetailSales) Average FROM liquor_store_sales GROUP BY Year, Quater

%md
#### 6.- Use a bar chart to plot the average `RetailSales` by `ItemType`, `Year` and `Month`.

msg.data: 6.- Use a bar chart to plot the average RetailSales by ItemType, Year and Month.

paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT Year, Quater ,ItemType, AVG(RetailSales) Average FROM liquor_store_sales GROUP BY ItemType, Year, Quater

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 7.- Use a scatter chart to plot the average `RetailSales` (x axis) and the average `RetailTransfers` (y axis) by `ItemType`.

msg.data: 7.- Use a scatter chart to plot the average RetailSales (x axis) and the average RetailTransfers (y axis) by ItemType.

paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT AVG(RetailSales), AVG(REtailTransfers), ItemType FROM liquor_store_sales GROUP BY ItemType

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 8.- Use a line chart to plot the evolution per `Month` of the average `RetailSales` of `Supplier` *SANTA MARGHERITA USA INC* during `Year` 2017.
**Hint**: Remember to use double quotes to open and close string values.

msg.data:
8.- Use a line chart to plot the evolution per Month of the average RetailSales of Supplier SANTA MARGHERITA USA INC during Year 2017.

Hint: Remember to use double quotes to open and close string values.

paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT Month, RetailSales FROM liquor_store_sales WHERE Supplier = "SANTA MARGHERITA USA INC" AND Year = 2017

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### 9.- Use a pie chart to find out which proportion of sales is associated to each item type.

msg.data: 9.- Use a pie chart to find out which proportion of sales is associated to each item type.

paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT SUM(RetailSales), ItemType FROM liquor_store_sales GROUP BY ItemType

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]
